<Asknews_articles>
Query: Will the community prediction be higher than 82.00% on 2026-02-14 for the Metaculus question "Will the Community beat Nathan Young in the Metaculus Cup Spring 2026?"?
Here are the relevant news articles:

**West Indies vs Scotland, T20 World Cup 2026 prediction: AI doesn't rule out a Scottish surprise**
In the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, West Indies are strong favorites to defeat Scotland in their Group-stage match at Eden Gardens, Kolkata, with two AI models—Gemini and ChatGPT—projecting a win probability of 85–89% for the West Indies. Gemini highlights the 'IPL factor,' noting that players like Shimron Hetmyer and Jason Holder have extensive experience playing in Kolkata, which gives them an edge on a pitch expected to slow down in the afternoon. The AI also emphasizes West Indies’ batting depth, with Shai Hope anchoring the innings and power hitters in the middle and lower order, projecting a score range of 175–190. Spinners Gudakesh Motie and Akeal Hosein are expected to play a key role as the pitch deteriorates. ChatGPT confirms West Indies’ superior T20 firepower and tournament experience, particularly on Indian conditions, as decisive factors. However, both models acknowledge Scotland’s potential to disrupt the game: they hold a 1–0 head-to-head advantage from their 2022 World Cup upset, and opener George Munsey is close to becoming Scotland’s leading T20I run-scorer. A 3:00 PM start may encourage batting first, and early wickets or a strong top-order performance could tighten the contest. Despite the odds favoring West Indies, Scotland’s freedom from pressure and past success make them a challenging opponent, especially if the Windies falter early. The prediction is based on AI analysis of team form, historical data, and recent performances, and is not a guarantee of the match outcome.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 07, 2026 05:30 AM
Source:[The Financial Express](https://www.financialexpress.com/sports/cricket/west-indies-vs-scotland-t20-world-cup-2026-prediction-ai-doesnt-rule-out-a-scottish-surprise/4134405/)

**'India's going to be hard to beat': Men in Blue backed to successfully defend T20 World Cup by Australian pace legends**
The Indian men's cricket team, led by Suryakumar Yadav, is widely regarded as the favourite to win the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup, having been the most dominant team in the format since their 2024 victory. They are co-hosts of the tournament alongside Sri Lanka and enter as defending champions. Under Yadav’s leadership since July 2024, India has won 33 of 41 matches, including a clean sweep in the Asia Cup and a 4-1 series win over New Zealand. A major boost came from Pakistan’s boycott of their Group A match in Colombo on 15 February 2026, resulting in a walkover for India. Australian pace legends Glenn McGrath, Damien Fleming, and Jason Gillespie, speaking on The Fast Bowling Cartel podcast, all named India as a top contender. McGrath stated, 'India's going to be hard to beat,' while Gillespie predicted India, South Africa, England, and Sri Lanka in the semi-finals, with South Africa as the eventual winner. Fleming picked India, South Africa, England, and Australia, though he expressed uncertainty. The tournament begins on 7 February 2026, with matches including India vs. USA and Pakistan vs. Netherlands.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 07, 2026 01:41 AM
Source:[Firstpost](https://www.firstpost.com/firstcricket/india-t20-world-cup-2026-prediction-mcgrath-gillespie-fleming-13977147.html)

**Nasser Hussain's T20 World Cup predictions: Winners, surprise packages, players to watch and how will England do?**
On the Sky Sports Cricket Podcast, former England captain Nasser Hussain made predictions for the 2026 Men's T20 World Cup, which ran from February 7 to March 8 and was broadcast live on Sky Sports. Hussain named India as his top pick, citing their status as defending champions, home advantage, strong six-hitting ability, and bowling depth. He predicted India would be joined in the semi-finals by England, South Africa, and Afghanistan. Afghanistan, under coach Jonathan Trott’s final tournament, were praised for their high-quality hitters, balanced bowling with seam, swing, and spin options, and experience from franchise leagues. Other teams in contention included Australia, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, West Indies, Nepal, Netherlands, and Scotland. Hussain highlighted Nepal’s passionate fan base and growing support, noting their potential to advance if they beat Scotland and Italy. He praised England’s strong batting lineup with Phil Salt and Jos Buttler opening, Harry Brook in the middle order, and Tom Banton’s development, while noting concerns over new-ball selection. Sam Curran’s return and Adil Rashid’s reliability were seen as positives. For individual awards, Hussain predicted Abhishek Sharma (India) as the leading run-scorer due to his form and power-hitting, and Jasprit Bumrah (India) as the top wicket-taker for his death-over effectiveness. He also noted Quinton de Kock’s return to form for South Africa and Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha’s strong performance at No. 3, supported by coach Mike Hesson’s calming influence.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 06, 2026 05:27 PM
Source:[SkySports](https://www.skysports.com/cricket/news/12080/13504168/nasser-hussains-t20-world-cup-predictions-winners-surprise-packages-players-to-watch-and-how-will-england-do)

**Preview of Round 22 of the Eredivisie: PSV's Title Lead, Key Matchups, and Predictions**
The 22nd round of the Eredivisie features several key matchups with implications for standings and team form. PSV has extended their lead to 17 points, making the title nearly certain, while the battle for European spots intensifies. N.E.C. remains the most attacking team in the league, with the highest goal tally after PSV, and is predicted to score in both halves against Heracles, who are recovering from a losing streak. In a match between Vitesse and VVV-Venlo, Vitesse's strong home form and VVV's poor away record, including eight consecutive losses, suggest a strong first-half performance by Vitesse, with a clean sheet in the first half expected. In a low-scoring clash between Twente and Herenven, both teams have poor finishing records but strong defenses, leading to a prediction of more goals in the second half due to fatigue and defensive errors. Fortuna Sittard faces Sparta Rotterdam, who are in excellent form, and despite Fortuna's poor defensive record, they are expected to score at least one goal. In a match between Utrecht and Feyenoord, both teams have weak defenses and strong attacks, leading to a prediction of both teams scoring with a total over 2.5 goals. In the central fixture of the round, Ajax and AZ face off in a North Holland derby, with AZ having won the last 10 meetings, including a 6-0 victory. Despite Ajax's desire to recover, AZ's defensive focus and recent form suggest a tight game with both teams scoring but fewer than 4.5 total goals. In Deventer, Go Ahead Eagles, motivated by a recent cup defeat, are expected to beat Telstar, who are winless in 15 games. In the final match, PSV are heavily favored to beat Groningen, who are without key defenders due to yellow card accumulation and in poor form. PSV is predicted to win, potentially securing the title as early as April 4, 2026, if they win all remaining games. All predictions are based on team form, injuries, and historical trends, with disclaimers that outcomes are uncertain and bets should be placed responsibly.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 06, 2026 03:28 PM
Source:[Sports.ru](https://www.sports.ru/football/blogs/3382680.html)

**India vs USA T20 World Cup 2026: Check predicted XI, weather, pitch report and more**
India will begin its T20 World Cup 2026 title defense against the USA on February 7, 2026, at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. The tournament, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka, marks the first match of the event. Suryakumar Yadav will captain a restructured Indian team, as Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are absent, while Suryakumar Yadav and Ishan Kishan return. India's batting lineup features Abhishek Sharma, Tilak Varma, Rinku Singh, and finishers Shivam Dube. The Wankhede pitch is expected to favor batsmen, being flat with good bounce and carry, as demonstrated in the last men's T20I on February 2, 2025, where India defeated England by 150 runs. Weather on match day is forecast to be clear with a temperature of 32°C, wind speed of 13 km/h, and zero probability of precipitation or thunderstorms. The predicted Indian playing XI includes Suryakumar Yadav (c), Abhishek Sharma, Ishan Kishan (wk), Tilak Varma, Rinku Singh, Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel (vc), Shivam Dube, Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, and Varun Chakravarthy. The USA's predicted XI comprises Andries Gous, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Shayan Jahangir, Monank Patel (c & wk), Milind Kumar, Harmeet Singh, Shubham Ranjane, Sanjai Krishnamurthi, Mohammed Mohsin, Shadley Van Schalkwyk, and Saurabh Netravalkar.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 06, 2026 02:38 PM
Source:[The Financial Express](https://www.financialexpress.com/sports/india-vs-usa-t20-world-cup-2026-check-predicted-xi-weather-pitch-report-and-more/4133920/)

**Top run-scorer, wicket-taker and champion - T20 World Cup predictions**
The 2026 T20 World Cup, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka, is set to begin on February 7, 2026, with India as defending champions and hosting the tournament. Multiple experts from the Test Match Special (TMS) team predict India as the favorite to win, citing home advantage, strong form, and familiarity with local conditions. Former England bowlers Steven Finn, Alex Hartley, Tymal Mills, and Daniel Norcross all favor India, with Hartley noting no team has ever won a men's T20 World Cup on home soil. BBC’s Henry Moeran acknowledges India’s confidence but warns of potential home pressure and widespread IPL experience among global players. Others like Prakash Wakankar highlight South Africa’s recent Test Championship win and Australia’s potential, while Aatif Nawaz and Matthew Henry emphasize India’s dominance despite concerns over injuries like Josh Hazlewood’s absence. For leading run-scorer, Abhishek Sharma is the top pick across multiple analysts due to his explosive strike rate, home conditions, and debut tournament opportunity, with Travis Head, Aiden Markram, and Suryakumar Yadav also mentioned. Key batters to watch include Dewald Brevis, Finn Allen, Tom Banton, and Wayne Madsen (a long shot). For leading wicket-taker, Jasprit Bumrah is heavily favored for his death-over mastery and past final performance, followed by Kuldeep Yadav, Nathan Ellis, and Abrar Ahmed. Notable bowlers to watch include Usman Tariq (Pakistan), Azmatullah Omarzai (Afghanistan), Noor Ahmad (Afghanistan), Anrich Nortje (South Africa), Chakravarthy, and Saim Ayub (Pakistan), with Keshav Maharaj highlighted for his form and experience. All predictions are based on pre-tournament assessments as of February 6, 2026.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 06, 2026 08:08 AM
Source:[Yahoo Sports Canada](https://ca.sports.yahoo.com/news/top-run-scorer-wicket-taker-074501478.html)

**Sunil Gavaskar picks two former champions as 2026 T20 World Cup finalists, predicts the winner**
Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has predicted that India will defend their 2026 T20 World Cup title, with the final set to be contested between India and England. He identified England, New Zealand, South Africa, and India as the likely semifinalists, citing England's strong recent form, including a 3-0 series sweep over Sri Lanka. Gavaskar emphasized India's superiority in preparation, contrasting it with Australia’s lack of focus post-Ashes, and noted that India has won eight consecutive T20I series since their 2024 World Cup victory, including series wins against Australia (2-1), South Africa (3-1), and New Zealand (4-1). India also defeated South Africa by 30 runs in a warm-up match. The tournament begins on February 7, 2026, with India facing the USA in Mumbai. Gavaskar stated, 'In my opinion, these teams will be the semifinalists - India, New Zealand, England, and South Africa. I think the final will be played between India and England, and the former will win.'
Original language: en
Publish date: February 05, 2026 01:26 PM
Source:[Sportskeeda](https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/news-sunil-gavaskar-picks-two-former-champions-2026-t20-world-cup-finalists-predicts-winner)

**USA T20 World Cup 2026 team preview: Squad, fixtures, probable XI, key players, tournament prediction**
The United States cricket team is preparing for the 2026 T20 World Cup with high hopes after their impressive performance in the 2024 tournament on home soil, where they defeated Pakistan in a dramatic super over and advanced to the Super 8 stage. The 15-member squad, announced on January 30, 2026, includes key players such as Monank Patel (captain), Saurabh Netravalkar, Andries Gous, Harmeet Singh, and Saiteja Mukkamalla, who is ranked 25th in the world among batters. The probable playing XI, based on training camps and warm-up matches, features Andries Gous (wicketkeeper), Monank Patel (captain), Shehan Jayasuriya, Milind Kumar, Shayan Jahangir, Shubham Ranjane, Harmeet Singh, Shadley Van Schalkwyk, Jessy Singh, Saurabh Netravalkar, and Ali Khan. The USA’s group fixtures are: February 7 vs India (Mumbai), February 10 vs Pakistan (Colombo), February 13 vs Netherlands (Chennai), and February 15 vs Namibia (Chennai). While the team is expected to challenge the Netherlands and Namibia for third place, qualifying for the Super 8s over top-tier teams like India or Pakistan would require a major upset, given the favorable conditions for those sides. The USA’s 2024 success, including winning the North America T20 Cup and sweeping Oman 3-0, demonstrates their growing strength and potential to cause further upsets.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 05, 2026 01:13 PM
Source:[theweek.in](https://www.theweek.in/news/sports/2026/02/04/usa-t20-world-cup-2026-team-preview-squad-fixtures-probable-xi-key-players-tournament-prediction.html)

**From winner to leading wicket scorer: Glenn McGrath's bold set of predictions for the T20 World Cup 2026**
Australian pace legend Glenn McGrath has made bold predictions for the T20 World Cup 2026 on The Fast Bowling Cartel YouTube channel. He predicts Afghanistan's Rashid Khan will be the leading wicket-taker, citing his 187 T20I wickets in 111 matches, a career economy rate of 6.02, and a bowling average of 13.59. McGrath highlights Rashid’s 2 five-wicket hauls and 9 four-wicket hauls, expecting him to reach 200 T20I wickets during the tournament. For the highest run-scorer, McGrath backs India’s Abhishek Sharma, the current World No. 1 ranked T20I batter, who has a career strike rate of 194.74 and 1,297 runs in 38 innings, including 2 centuries and 8 fifties. McGrath points to Sharma’s 'Player of the Tournament' performance in the 2025 Asia Cup (314 runs) and a recent 249.31 strike rate against New Zealand as evidence of his dominance. McGrath forecasts an India vs South Africa final, predicting India will defend their 2024 title, citing their balanced attack with world-class spin and Jasprit Bumrah’s pace, as well as their advantage playing in subcontinental conditions due to the tournament being hosted by India and Sri Lanka.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 04, 2026 04:14 AM
Source:[Yardbarker](https://www.yardbarker.com/cricket/articles/from_winner_to_leading_wicket_scorer_glenn_mcgraths_bold_set_of_predictions_for_the_t20_world_cup_2026/s1_17756_43423838)

**High School National Championship in 'Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel' Crowned @イグニ☆'S as Japan's Best**
KONAMI held the first-ever 'High School National Championship' for 'Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel' on February 1, 2026, featuring 209 teams of high school students from across Japan. The tournament used a double-elimination format with a reset-free Grand Final, and each player could register two decks. The card pool and limit rules were based on the December 2025 'Duelist Cup,' excluding the 'Yami' theme from the 'The Apical Predators' pack and allowing unrestricted use of cards like 'M∀LICE' White Rabbit' and 'Dark Temptation'—making 'M∀LICE' decks stronger than in the current meta. The final match was contested between @イグニ☆'S (Ichott and Cheese) and Uchumaguki (Sebek and Nia). @イグニ☆'S won the championship after a hard-fought battle, defeating Uchumaguki in the Grand Final. Ichott and Cheese, both first-year high school students with about 1.5 years of Master Duel experience, demonstrated exceptional strategic depth, adaptability, and teamwork. Their victory was attributed to mental resilience, especially after losing their first match, and strong deck-building that accounted for the unique tournament environment. They used a mixed 'Demonsmith' and 'Dragon Tail' deck and a 'Tiarament' deck for surprise attacks. The winning team expressed joy and surprise at their victory, citing their passion for Master Duel and strong practice routines. The event also featured insights from commentator Tatsuku, who praised the tournament's team dynamics, the boldness of choosing weaker decks against strong ones, and the importance of personal deck preference. Tatsuku emphasized the game's strategic depth, card storytelling, and the need for more initiatives to grow the Yu-Gi-Oh! community, especially among youth. The championship highlighted the rising talent among young players and set a strong foundation for future events.
Original language: ja
Publish date: February 03, 2026 12:00 PM
Source:[4Gamer](https://www.4gamer.net/games/585/G058543/20260203028/)

**World Cup 2026 predicted as winners, dark horse and England's fate mapped - The Mirror**
The Mirror's chief football writers have made predictions for the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the first to feature 48 nations and hosted by the United States, Canada, and Mexico, with the tournament set to take place in summer for the first time since 2018. The top four seeds—Argentina, Spain, France, and England—are seen as the strongest contenders, with Argentina favored to win due to Lionel Messi’s likely final World Cup campaign, a strong squad, and manager Lionel Scaloni’s proven track record. Spain is highlighted for its technical excellence and possession-based style, with Lamine Yamal emerging as a potential star. England is viewed as an outsider in the final four, despite having a talented squad featuring Harry Kane, Declan Rice, Jude Bellingham, and Bukayo Saka, but concerns remain over defensive stability and the physical demands of traveling across three countries and enduring extreme heat. Ecuador is named as a dark horse, with a strong midfield led by Moises Caicedo, potentially advancing deep into the knockout stages. France remains a threat due to Kylian Mbappé and Michael Olise, while Senegal and the USA are also seen as potential surprise performers. The writers caution that the grueling schedule, heat, and travel may reduce on-field quality, with dead-ball situations and substitutions expected to play a larger role. The article notes that only Italy and Brazil have won back-to-back World Cups, and Argentina, having won in 2022, has a realistic chance to repeat. The piece concludes with the prediction that the tournament will be physically taxing, potentially affecting performance, but England’s squad depth could give them an edge if they survive the extended knockout stages.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2026 10:00 AM
Source:[Mirror](https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/world-cup-2026-predicted-winner-36656145)

**Former cricketer predicts once runners-up to beat India in T20 World Cup 2026 final**
Former Australian pacer Jason Gillespie predicts that South Africa, the 2024 T20 World Cup runners-up, will defeat defending champions India in the 2026 T20 World Cup final, which will be held in India and Sri Lanka starting February 7, 2026. Gillespie's prediction is supported by fellow former Australian cricketer Glenn McGrath, who also anticipates an India-South Africa final, though he believes India remains the team to beat despite the possibility of an upset. Damien Fleming similarly backs India to defend their title, citing Abhishek Sharma as a dominant batsman and a strong spin bowling attack, along with Jasprit Bumrah’s wicket-taking ability. India is placed in Group A with Pakistan, Namibia, the Netherlands, and the USA, while South Africa is in the challenging Group D with New Zealand, Afghanistan, Canada, and the UAE. The top two teams from each of the four groups will advance to the Super Eights, followed by the semifinals and final. McGrath believes Australia may struggle to qualify for the semifinals, while Fleming includes Australia among the four semifinalists, alongside India, South Africa, and England. Gillespie excludes Australia from his semifinal picks, instead selecting India, South Africa, England, and Sri Lanka. India and England are the only two-time T20 World Cup champions.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2026 05:36 AM
Source:[Sportskeeda](https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/news-former-cricketer-predicts-runners-up-beat-india-t20-world-cup-2026-final)

**2026 Premier League Darts Night 1 draw, match predictions and 3 storylines to watch**
The 2026 Premier League Darts begins in Newcastle with Night 1 featuring quarterfinal matchups. Luke Littler is predicted to defeat Jonny Clayton 6-4 in his first career PL match, having previously beaten Clayton at the 2025 World Cup. Luke Humphries is expected to edge out Gian van Veen 6-5, continuing his dominance over van Veen despite the latter's strong recent form. Stephen Bunting is predicted to beat Michael van Gerwen 6-4, capitalizing on MVG’s inconsistent performance over the past year. In another match, Luke Littler is projected to defeat Davey van der Wal 6-3. Humphries is predicted to advance to the final with a 6-2 win over Stephen Bunting, following a strong performance at the World Masters. The final is forecasted to be a Luke vs. Luke showdown, with Humphries overcoming Littler in a potential revenge match after losing to him in the 2026 World Masters Final. Key storylines include the high-stakes debut of van Veen in a packed arena, the anticipated clash between Littler and Humphries, and Bunting’s quest to rebound after a difficult 12-month period. The article notes that Littler and Humphries were both exceptional at the World Masters, with Price being the only player capable of disrupting the format. All predictions are based on current form and recent performances.

**Concacaf Champions Cup 2026: Preview, Predictions for Every Round One Matchup**
The 2026 Concacaf Champions Cup begins with 11 first-round matches featuring 27 clubs from North America, Central America, and the Caribbean, with the winner earning a spot in the 2029 FIFA Club World Cup. Five teams—Inter Miami, Seattle Sounders, Deportivo Toluca, Mount Pleasant, and Alajuelense—received byes to the round of 16. San Diego FC, in their second season, faces a tough challenge against Pumas UNAM, a three-time Champions Cup winner, but Pumas are predicted to advance due to stronger midseason form. The LA Galaxy, despite a disappointing 2025 MLS season, are favored over Panama’s Sporting San Miguelito, bolstered by new signings like João Klauss and Marco Reus, with a predicted win. Cruz Azul, seven-time champions, are heavy favorites against last-place Canadian Premier League side Vancouver FC, with a lopsided tie expected. CF Monterrey, despite recent roster changes, are predicted to defeat Guatemala’s Club Xelajú. LAFC, led by Son Heung-min and Denis Bouanga, are favored over Honduras’s Real España. Nashville SC are expected to advance past Atlético Ottawa, though the latter could pull off an upset. Club América, seeking an eighth title, are favored over Honduras’s Club Olimpia. The Philadelphia Union, despite major roster losses, are predicted to beat Trinidad and Tobago’s Defence Force FC. Tigres UANL, recent Apertura finalists, are favored over Canada’s Forge FC. FC Cincinnati are expected to defeat Dominican Republic’s O&M FC. Vancouver Whitecaps FC, despite stadium uncertainties, are predicted to advance past Costa Rica’s CS Cartaginés. The tournament's first round sets up high-stakes matchups leading into the round of 16 on May 31.

**2026 PDC World Darts Championship predictions: Previewing and picking the winners of the third round**
The third round of the 2026 PDC World Darts Championship, scheduled for December 27–29, features 16 high-stakes matchups with predictions based on player form, averages, and historical performance. Andrew Gilding is predicted to defeat Ratajski 4-2, capitalizing on consistency and doubles efficiency. Jonny Clayton is favored over Niels Zonneveld 4-3, with edge in doubling accuracy. **Announcing Spring 2026 AI Forecasting Benchmark  --  LessWrong**
Metaculus is preparing for the Spring 2026 AI Forecasting Benchmark, part of its ongoing series of tournaments designed to evaluate and improve AI forecasting accuracy. These tournaments involve frontier AI models, bot developers, and a human baseline, aiming to advance innovation in AI forecasting, support AI safety and decision-making applications, and enhance AI development skills. The Fall Bot Tournament is nearing completion, and the Spring Bot Tournament is now in preparation. Participation offers opportunities to contribute to AI advancement, refine technical abilities, and earn rewards for high performance. Additional ways to compete using bots are available on the Metaculus platform. The announcement was published on December 18, 2025, by Maya Farber Brodsky.

**The 2026 World Cup Has Been Simulated in Full After the Draw - It's Predicted a Cracker**
The 2026 FIFA World Cup, set to be hosted by the United States, Mexico, and Canada, is the subject of a full simulation by GiveMeSport based on current form and team dynamics. The tournament expands to 48 teams, forming 12 groups of four, with the top two teams and eight best third-place finishers advancing to the knockout stages. Predicted group winners include Czechia, Switzerland, Brazil, Paraguay, Germany, Iran, Japan, Spain, France, Argentina, Colombia, and England. Runners-up and top third-place teams such as Mexico, Canada, Scotland, the United States, Ecuador, Tunisia, Egypt, Uruguay, Iraq, Jordan, Portugal, Croatia, South Korea, Qatar, Morocco, Turkey, Saudi Arabia, Algeria, DR Congo, and Panama are also predicted to advance. In the Round of 32, notable predicted outcomes include Germany defeating Morocco 4-3, France beating Turkey 3-2, England thrashing DR Congo 5-0, and Uruguay eliminating Argentina 3-2. In the Last 16, France defeats Germany 4-0, Spain beats Portugal 1-0, and England edges Saudi Arabia 4-3. The Quarter-Finals see France beat Mexico 3-0, Spain defeat Paraguay 2-0, England overcome Brazil 2-1, and Switzerland reach their first-ever semi-final by beating Uruguay 2-1. The Semi-Finals are predicted to feature France defeating Spain 2-1 and England narrowly beating Switzerland 1-0. The Final is forecasted to be a dramatic 3-2 victory for France over England at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey, with Switzerland winning the third-place playoff 1-0 against Spain. The simulation highlights France as the eventual champions, marking their second World Cup title, while England, despite strong qualifying form, falls short in the final. The predictions are based on team strength, historical performance, and tactical analysis.

**AI Predicts World Cup Champions Until the End of the 21st Century**
Grok AI has predicted the winners of the FIFA World Cup from 2026 to 2098, presenting a series of unexpected outcomes. The company forecasts that Spain will win the 2026 World Cup by defeating defending champions Argentina 2-1 in the final. Brazil will claim the title in 2030, beating France 3-1, avenging their 1998 final loss. France will win in 2034, defeating Germany 2-0, while England will triumph in 2038 by beating Brazil 1-0. Nigeria will become the first African nation to win the tournament in 2042, defeating Argentina 2-1. Germany will win in 2046, beating Spain 3-2. Argentina will return to the top in 2050, with Lionel Messi at age 63 defeating Portugal, as Cristiano Ronaldo turns 65. The United States will win for the first time in 2054, beating Mexico 2-1. Japan will become the first Asian champion in 2058, defeating France 1-0. Italy will win the 2062 final, defeating Brazil 2-1, ending Brazil’s 100-year championship drought. Morocco will become the first Arab nation to win in 2066, defeating England 3-2. Brazil will repeat their 2002 final victory over Germany in 2070, winning 4-2. Australia will win in 2074, beating Spain 2-1. Portugal will win in 2078, defeating France 3-2, just seven years before Ronaldo’s 100th birthday. Senegal will win in 2082, beating Argentina 1-0. The Netherlands will triumph in 2086, defeating Italy 3-1. Mexico will win in 2090, beating the USA 2-1. India will win in 2094, defeating Brazil 2-2 in regulation and winning on penalties. Finally, Germany will win the 2098 World Cup, defeating Portugal 2-0 in the final. These predictions are based on AI modeling and are not grounded in current performance or real-world data.

**Supercomputer Has Predicted the 2026 World Cup in Full Ahead of the Draw**
A supercomputer simulation by Jeffbet has predicted the full outcome of the 2026 FIFA World Cup, which will be hosted by the United States, Canada, and Mexico. The tournament will feature 12 groups, with the top two teams from each group and the eight best third-place finishers advancing to the knockout stages. The predicted group winners include Senegal, Paraguay, Spain, Switzerland, Croatia, Brazil, Argentina, England, France, Germany, Norway, and Portugal, with Norway’s Erling Haaland expected to lead the scoring with 12 goals in the group stage. The round of 32 predictions include Croatia defeating Turkey in a penalty shootout, France beating Scotland 2-0, Canada defeating Mexico 2-0, Brazil edging Iran 1-0, Netherlands defeating Austria 2-0, England defeating Jordan 4-0, Denmark beating South Korea 1-0, Argentina defeating Switzerland 3-0, Spain defeating Morocco 2-0, Belgium defeating Uruguay 2-1 (with Australia advancing on penalties), Portugal defeating South Africa 3-0, Germany defeating Colombia 2-1, Italy defeating the United States 2-1, Paraguay defeating Panama 2-0, and Norway defeating Egypt 3-1. In the last 16, France defeat Croatia 2-0, Brazil defeat Canada 3-0, England defeat Netherlands 2-2 (penalties), Argentina defeat Denmark 4-2, Spain defeat Belgium 2-0, Australia defeat Portugal 3-1, Germany defeat Italy 2-1, and Norway defeat Paraguay 2-1. In the quarter-finals, France defeat Brazil 2-1, England defeat Argentina 2-0, Portugal defeat Spain 2-2 (penalties), and Norway defeat Germany 1-1 (penalties). In the semi-finals, England defeat France 1-0, and Portugal defeat Norway 2-0. The final is predicted to be England versus Portugal at Hard Rock Stadium in New York on July 19, 2026, with England winning 1-0 to claim their first World Cup title since 1966 and their first major tournament victory since then. The simulation highlights England’s clean-sheet streak through the group stage and knockout rounds, as well as Norway’s historic run to the semi-finals and Portugal’s final appearance in Cristiano Ronaldo’s last tournament.

**How AI Outperforms Humans in Forecasting the Future**
Every three months, participants in the Metaculus Cup use artificial intelligence to predict geopolitical events in hopes of winning a prize of about $5,000. The platform poses questions such as 'Will Thailand experience a military coup before September 2025?' and 'Will Israel strike the Iranian army again before September 2025?' Experts estimate probabilities rather than simple yes/no answers. For example, Metaculus users correctly predicted the Russian invasion of Ukraine two weeks in advance and assigned a 90 % probability to the U.S. v. Wade case roughly two months before it occurred. When the competition began in June, participants expected AI to outperform humans by 40 % on average, but the Mantic AI system achieved over 80 % accuracy. Prediction experts update their forecasts based on policy changes, allowing them to anticipate how virtual political interventions might affect future outcomes. Broad geopolitical forecasting remains extremely difficult, often requiring days and tens of thousands of dollars for a single question. The Rand Corporation estimates that human experts would need months to produce initial forecasts for all questions and to update them regularly. AI excels in data-rich, well-structured domains like weather or quantitative finance, but for geopolitics it must handle many interrelated factors. Large language models use the same complex information as human forecasters and can simulate human judgment, improving over time by predicting many questions, observing performance, and updating methods on a larger scale than humans can. Machines also have an unfair advantage in the competition: participants earn points not only for accuracy but also for coverage, the number of questions answered, and the frequency of updates. Even less accurate AI can rank highly by continuously updating estimates in response to emerging news—a feat impossible for humans. This unfair advantage helps AI overcome the remaining challenge of producing high‑quality predictions for all questions.

**AI Beats Humans In Predicting Future At International Competition**
A British AI startup, Mantic AI, co‑founded by a former Google DeepMind researcher, finished eighth in the Metaculus Cup, an international forecasting competition that asked participants to predict the likelihood of 60 events over the summer. The competition included high‑profile events such as the public spat between US President Donald Trump and Elon Musk and Kemi Badenoch’s removal from the Conservative Party leadership. Mantic AI’s performance surpassed 80 % of the average score of the top human forecasters, a significant improvement over the 40 % predicted by participants before the contest. Metaculus chief executive Deger Turan called the result 'impressive', while professional forecaster Ben Shindel admitted, 'It's certainly a weird feeling to be outdone by several bots at this point. We've really come a long way here compared with a year ago when the best bot was at something like rank 30.' Co‑founder Toby Shevlane noted that the system’s predictions were more original than most human entrants, arguing that “you could say our system's predictions were more original than most human entrants, because people often cluster around the community average predictions.” Mantic AI uses a mix of machine‑learning models from OpenAI, Google and DeepSeek to assign tasks based on each model’s strengths. Experts suggest that AI’s growing predictive accuracy could signal progress toward Artificial General Intelligence (AGI), with a Google DeepMind paper forecasting AGI as early as 2030.

**AI Is Learning to Predict the Future -- And Beating Humans at It**
Metaculus runs a quarterly forecasting cup in which participants predict geopolitical events for a prize pot of about $5,000. The platform poses questions such as 'Will Thailand experience a military coup before September 2025?' and 'Will Israel strike the Iranian military again before September 2025?'. Forecasters estimate probabilities weeks to months in advance, often with remarkable accuracy. For instance, users correctly predicted the date of the Russian invasion of Ukraine two weeks in advance, and assigned a 90 percent chance to Roe v. Wade being overturned almost two months before the decision.
